description: This course familiarizes the student with the major management functions of planning,
organizing, leading, and controlling. The study of management theory is linked with
application exercises. Students begin to develop the management skills necessary in any
organization, whether it be a for-profit or not-for-profit venture, a small business, or
a large corporation.This course is required for all students pursuing a management
studies concentration. Offered each semester. Prerequisite: one of Economics 110-121 or
